intro: Poicillopsis, commonly known as the green alga, is a genus of freshwater green algae belonging to the family Chlorococcales. It is characterized by its small, unicellular structure with a smooth, green cell wall. Poicillopsis species typically form colonies that are spherical or filamentous in shape. These algae play an important role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms. They are often found in ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams.
